Issues.Title: extending screens with raw fails max-* screens properties
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "extending screens with raw fails max-* screens properties" (#11698)

Issues.Title: `calc()` not normalizing
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v3.3.3

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

PostCSS `8.4.27`
PostCSS Loader `6.2.1`
Webpack `5.88.2`

Also reproduced in Tailwind Play (see below)

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

`16.13.0`

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

Windows

**Reproduction URL**

https://play.tailwindcss.com/7lVcDok0HN

**Describe your issue**

Unfortunately, I come bearing a case where `calc()` value is not properly normalized in an arbitrary value:

`[--foo:calc((704-320)/(1400-782))]`

Which I then extrapolated to more cases to try to narrow down a pattern:

‚ùå `w-[calc((7-32)/(1400-782))]`
‚úÖ `[--foo:calc((7-3)/(1400-782))]`
‚ùå `[--foo:calc((7-32)/(1400-782))]`
‚úÖ `[--foo:calc((70-3)/(1400-782))]`
‚ùå `[--foo:calc((70-32)/(1400-782))]`
‚úÖ `[--foo:calc((704-3)/(1400-782))]`
‚úÖ `[--foo:calc((704-320))]`
‚ùå `[--foo:calc((704-320)/1)]`
‚ùå `[--foo:calc((704-320)/(1400-782))]`

For the classes marked with a cross (‚ùå), there is no space around the subtraction operator (`-`) in the first set of parentheses in the generated CSS rule value, causing the `calc()` value to be invalid.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "`calc()` not normalizing" (#11682)

Issues.Title: Improve normalisation of `calc()`-like functions
Issues.Body:
This PR improves the normalisation of `calc()` functions.

In CSS, functions such as `calc()` require spaces around the operators. However, when writing Tailwind CSS classes we can't really use spaces. There are 2 solutions to this problem:

1. You write a `_` instead of a space, which we will convert to a space behind the scenes
2. You don't write any spaces or `_` characters, and you let Tailwind inject the spaces for you

Typically, you would let Tailwind inject the spaces, but we didn't catch all cases. This PR improves that by introducing a mini-parser for handling spaces around operators.

Looking at the examples given in #11682, then the updated result would look like this:

| Input                        | Before                           | After                              |
| ---------------------------- | -------------------------------- | ---------------------------------- |
| `calc((7-32)/(1400-782))`    | `calc((7-32) / (1400 - 782))`    | `calc((7 - 32) / (1400 - 782))`    |
| `calc((7-3)/(1400-782))`     | `calc((7 - 3) / (1400 - 782))`   | `calc((7 - 3) / (1400 - 782))`     |
| `calc((7-32)/(1400-782))`    | `calc((7-32) / (1400 - 782))`    | `calc((7 - 32) / (1400 - 782))`    |
| `calc((70-3)/(1400-782))`    | `calc((70 - 3) / (1400 - 782))`  | `calc((70 - 3) / (1400 - 782))`    |
| `calc((70-32)/(1400-782))`   | `calc((70-32) / (1400 - 782))`   | `calc((70 - 32) / (1400 - 782))`   |
| `calc((704-3)/(1400-782))`   | `calc((704 - 3) / (1400 - 782))` | `calc((704 - 3) / (1400 - 782))`   |
| `calc((704-320))`            | `calc((704 - 320))`              | `calc((704 - 320))`                |
| `calc((704-320)/1)`          | `calc((704-320) / 1)`            | `calc((704 - 320) / 1)`            |
| `calc((704-320)/(1400-782))` | `calc((704-320) / (1400 - 782))` | `calc((704 - 320) / (1400 - 782))` |

Fixes: #11682

<!--

üëã Hey, thanks for your interest in contributing to Tailwind!

**Please ask first before starting work on any significant new features.**

It's never a fun experience to have your pull request declined after investing a lot of time and effort into a new feature. To avoid this from happening, we request that contributors create an issue to first discuss any significant new features. This includes things like adding new utilities, creating new at-rules, or adding new component examples to the documentation.

https://github.com/tailwindcss/tailwindcss/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md

-->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Improve normalisation of `calc()`-like functions" (#11686)

Issues.Title: Add forced-colors variant
Issues.Body:
Add a variant for the [`forced-colors`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/@media/forced-colors) media query.

Also add a contrast-custom variant to match [custom contrast](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/@media/prefers-contrast#:~:text=level%20of%20contrast.-,custom,-Indicates%20that%20user) preferences

Like with #11693 i've only added a variant for `forced-colors: active` because the `forced-colors: none` case isn't overly useful.

This has widespread browser support across multiple platforms
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add forced-colors variant" (#11694)

Issues.Title: Add inverted-colors variant
Issues.Body:
Add a variant for the [`inverted-colors`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/@media/inverted-colors) media query.

This has been supported in Safari for a while. I'm also implementing support in Chrome atm.

I've decided to only add the inverted-colors: inverted variant because the `none` state isn't really useful.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add inverted-colors variant" (#11693)

Issues.Title: Add prefers-reduced-transparency variants
Issues.Body:
Adds support for the [`prefers-reduced-transparency`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/@media/prefers-reduced-transparency) media query.

I've implemented and filed a Chrome Intent to Ship for this feature: https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/EiZ2vlPy9xs
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add prefers-reduced-transparency variants" (#11692)

Issues.Title: border class adding default color and not removing
Issues.Body: **What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** For example: v3.3.3 **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** I am using Ruby on Rails, and npm package 14.19.0 to compile **What version of Node.js are you using?** For example: v14.19.1 **What browser are you using?** For example: Chrome **What operating system are you using?** For example: macOS **Describe your issue** I have added `border` class to a component and upon adding `border-red-500` it is not changing the color of the border. However it works when I user `border-2` I see that the default border class is set, can someone guide?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "border class adding default color and not removing" (#11690)

Issues.Title: customized screen does not generate max-* modifier
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

For example: v2.0.4
tailwind 3.3.2
nextjs 13.4.6
nodejs 18.16.1
chrome
macos 
in doc https://tailwindcss.com/docs/responsive-design , it reads:
Tailwind generates a corresponding max-* modifier for each breakpoint

however, if i customize screens, then max-* is not available, only customized screens is available
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "customized screen does not generate max-* modifier" (#11683)

Issues.Title: Update @napi-rs/cli 2.16.1 ‚Üí 2.16.2 (patch)
Issues.Body:
Here is everything you need to know about this update. Please take a good look at what changed and the test results before merging this pull request. ### What changed? #### ‚ú≥Ô∏è sucrase (3.32.0 ‚Üí 3.34.0) ¬∑ [Repo](https://github.com/alangpierce/sucrase) ¬∑ [Changelog](https://github.com/alangpierce/sucrase/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md)
Release Notes

3.34.0 (from changelog)

  • Add CLI options for all remaining Sucrase options, e.g. --disable-es-transforms for disableESTransforms. (<<-ArS, Alan Pierce) (#670, #812)
  • Add SUCRASE_OPTIONS environment variable for configuring sucrase/register, sucrase-node, and any programmatic require hook usages. The value must be a valid JSON object of Sucrase options that will be merged with the usual options. (#813)

3.33.0 (from changelog)

  • Add an option keepUnusedImports that disables all automatic import/export elision, equivalent to the TypeScript option verbatimModuleSyntax. (#811, #615) (Kotaro Chikuba, Alan Pierce)
  • Add support for the await using proposal and the updated import attributes proposal. Both are preserved in the output code, not transformed. (#798)
  • Fix some issues with TypeScript automatic export elision in export {...} from statements. (#806)
    • Type names from the current file are no longer removed.
    • When all exports are type exports, the entire statement is now removed.
  • Fix bug where fn(x < y, x >= y) was incorrectly parsed as type arguments. (#798)
  • Fix a few bugs in enableLegacyBabel5ModuleInterop: properly handle as default, and properly ignore type exports. (#804, #807) (‰∏âÂí≤Êô∫Â≠ê Kevin Deng, Alan Pierce)
  • Fix bug where parameters inside function types could be misinterpreted as declarations and result in imports being incorrectly marked as unused. (#809)
  • Fix bug where import {} and export {} statements were removed with the TypeScript transform disabled. (#810)
  • Make the transform behavior more forgiving when code accidentally has a return type annotation on a constructor. (#800)

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

Issues.Title: Support async functions in tailwind.config
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

"tailwindcss": "3.3.3"

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

"next": "13.4.10",

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

‚ùØ node -v
v18.13.0

**What browser are you using?**

chrome, NA

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS

**Reproduction URL**

https://github.com/sramam/zz-tailwind-config-async


**Describe your issue**
I need to load files and process in a tailwind plugin. The processing is an async operation
and, making the plugin an async function. `tailwind.config.ts` doesn't seem to like async functions. 

The repo above provides the smallest reproduction I could make to illustrate the issue.

To reproduce:
```
git clone https://github.com/sramam/zz-tailwind-config-async
cd zz-tailwind-config-async
pnpm install
pnpm dev
```
visit [https://localhost:3000](https://localhost:3000)

edit `tailwind.config.ts` [Line 41](https://github.com/sramam/zz-tailwind-config-async/blob/main/tailwind.config.ts#L41):

```
-   theme: asyncTheme(),
+   theme: syncTheme(),
```

Notice the orange text background.

## Desired Behavior
The async function not just for themes, but plugins and everywhere else, should work like the sync versions.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Support async functions in tailwind.config " (#11655)

Issues.Title: Mismatch of matchVariant type definition from implementation
Issues.Body:
Hi Tailwind maintainers! This is my first issue opened on the repo, so if there is anything I'm missing that would be helpful, let me know. I came across this while implementing a custom plugin that needed to walk the rules to find a particular declaration.

The implementation of `matchVariant` exposes `container` alongside `modifier`:

https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/blob/6eed8cb3f6e9673990d1773b8b0e2cf5f1b3a02e/src/lib/setupContextUtils.js#L591
https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/blob/6eed8cb3f6e9673990d1773b8b0e2cf5f1b3a02e/src/lib/setupContextUtils.js#L613-L620

However, the type definition does not include `container` in the callback function arguments:

https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/blob/6eed8cb3f6e9673990d1773b8b0e2cf5f1b3a02e/types/config.d.ts#L314-L324

That results in a mismatch when defining my config file with TypeScript.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Mismatch of matchVariant type definition from implementation" (#11664)

Issues.Title: Update eslint 8.43.0 ‚Üí 8.45.0 (minor)
Issues.Body:
Here is everything you need to know about this update. Please take a good look at what changed and the test results before merging this pull request. ### What changed? #### ‚ú≥Ô∏è eslint (8.43.0 ‚Üí 8.45.0) ¬∑ [Repo](https://github.com/eslint/eslint) ¬∑ [Changelog](https://github.com/eslint/eslint/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md)
Release Notes

8.45.0

Features

  • cdd063c feat: Expose LegacyESLint in unsupported API (#17341) (Nicholas C. Zakas)
  • d34abe5 feat: fix indent rule for else-if (#17318) (Milos Djermanovic)

Bug Fixes

  • b79b6fb fix: Fix suggestion message in no-useless-escape (#17339) (Francesco Trotta)
  • c667055 fix: provide unique fix and fix.range objects in lint messages (#17332) (Milos Djermanovic)

Documentation

  • 89f3225 docs: add playground links to correct and incorrect code blocks (#17306) (Josh Goldberg ‚ú®)
  • f8892b5 docs: Expand rule option schema docs (#17198) (Matt Wilkinson)
  • 8bcbf11 docs: Config Migration Guide (#17230) (Ben Perlmutter)
  • bb30908 docs: Update README (GitHub Actions Bot)
  • 84d243b docs: Update README (GitHub Actions Bot)
  • b762632 docs: Update README (GitHub Actions Bot)
  • 138c096 docs: add more prefer-destructuring examples with array destructuring (#17330) (Milos Djermanovic)
  • 1fc50a8 docs: max-len rule code and tabWidth as positional arguments (#17331) (Jes√∫s Legan√©s-Combarro)

Chores

  • 68f63d7 chore: package.json update for @eslint/js release (ESLint Jenkins)
  • 5ca9b4d chore: update eslint-config-eslint exports (#17336) (Milos Djermanovic)
  • 7bf2e86 chore: remove unused dependencies (#17352) (Percy Ma)
  • c6f8cd0 chore: Remove defaultIgnores from FlatESLint private members (#17349) (Francesco Trotta)
  • 0052374 chore: move jsdoc settings to eslint-config-eslint (#17338) (ÂîØÁÑ∂)

8.44.0

Features

  • 1766771 feat: add es2023 and es2024 environments (#17328) (Milos Djermanovic)
  • 4c50400 feat: add ecmaVersion: 2024, regexp v flag parsing (#17324) (Milos Djermanovic)
  • 4d411e4 feat: add ternaryOperandBinaryExpressions option to no-extra-parens rule (#17270) (Percy Ma)
  • c8b1f4d feat: Move parserServices to SourceCode (#17311) (Milos Djermanovic)
  • ef6e24e feat: treat unknown nodes as having the lowest precedence (#17302) (Brad Zacher)
  • 1866e1d feat: allow flat config files to export a Promise (#17301) (Milos Djermanovic)

Bug Fixes

  • a36bcb6 fix: no-unused-vars false positive with logical assignment operators (#17320) (Gweesin Chan)
  • 7620b89 fix: Remove no-unused-labels autofix before potential directives (#17314) (Francesco Trotta)
  • 391ed38 fix: Remove no-extra-semi autofix before potential directives (#17297) (Francesco Trotta)

Documentation

  • 526e911 docs: resubmit pr 17115 doc changes (#17291) (ÂîØÁÑ∂)
  • e1314bf docs: Integration section and tutorial (#17132) (Ben Perlmutter)
  • 19a8c5d docs: Update README (GitHub Actions Bot)

Chores

  • 49e46ed chore: upgrade @eslint/js@8.44.0 (#17329) (Milos Djermanovic)
  • a1cb642 chore: package.json update for @eslint/js release (ESLint Jenkins)
  • 840a264 test: More test cases for no-case-declarations (#17315) (Elian Cordoba)
  • e6e74f9 chore: package.json update for eslint-config-eslint release (ESLint Jenkins)
  • eb3d794 chore: upgrade semver@7.5.3 (#17323) (Ziyad El Abid)
  • cf88439 chore: upgrade optionator@0.9.3 (#17319) (Milos Djermanovic)
  • 9718a97 refactor: remove unnecessary code in flat-eslint.js (#17308) (Milos Djermanovic)
  • f82e56e perf: various performance improvements (#17135) (moonlightaria)
  • da81e66 chore: update eslint-plugin-jsdoc to 46.2.5 (#17245) (ÂîØÁÑ∂)
  • b991640 chore: switch eslint-config-eslint to the flat format (#17247) (ÂîØÁÑ∂)

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

Commits

See the full diff on Github. The new version differs by 43 commits:

  • 8.45.0
  • Build: changelog update for 8.45.0
  • chore: package.json update for @eslint/js release
  • docs: add playground links to correct and incorrect code blocks (#17306)
  • docs: Expand rule option schema docs (#17198)
  • docs: Config Migration Guide (#17230)
  • docs: Update README
  • fix: Fix suggestion message in `no-useless-escape` (#17339)
  • docs: Update README
  • chore: update eslint-config-eslint exports (#17336)
  • docs: Update README
  • chore: remove unused dependencies (#17352)
  • chore: Remove `defaultIgnores` from FlatESLint private members (#17349)
  • feat: Expose LegacyESLint in unsupported API (#17341)
  • fix: provide unique `fix` and `fix.range` objects in lint messages (#17332)
  • docs: add more prefer-destructuring examples with array destructuring (#17330)
  • chore: move jsdoc settings to eslint-config-eslint (#17338)
  • feat: fix indent rule for else-if (#17318)
  • docs: `max-len` rule `code` and `tabWidth` as positional arguments (#17331)
  • 8.44.0
  • Build: changelog update for 8.44.0
  • chore: upgrade @eslint/js@8.44.0 (#17329)
  • chore: package.json update for @eslint/js release
  • feat: add `es2023` and `es2024` environments (#17328)
  • feat: add `ecmaVersion: 2024`, regexp `v` flag parsing (#17324)
  • feat: add ternaryOperandBinaryExpressions option to no-extra-parens rule (#17270)
  • test: More test cases for no-case-declarations (#17315)
  • chore: package.json update for eslint-config-eslint release
  • chore: upgrade semver@7.5.3 (#17323)
  • fix: no-unused-vars false positive with logical assignment operators (#17320)
  • feat: Move `parserServices` to `SourceCode` (#17311)
  • chore: upgrade optionator@0.9.3 (#17319)
  • fix: Remove `no-unused-labels` autofix before potential directives (#17314)
  • feat: treat unknown nodes as having the lowest precedence (#17302)
  • refactor: remove unnecessary code in `flat-eslint.js` (#17308)

  • perf: various performance improvements (#17135)

Issues.Title: Utilities do not work with prefix
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

3.3.3

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

N/A

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

18.16.1

**What browser are you using?**

N/A

**What operating system are you using?**

N/A

**Reproduction URL**

https://play.tailwindcss.com/23jQdQle1e


**Describe your issue**


When setting prefix in the tailwindcss config utility classes are not working - in the example using `peer` and `group`, but I guess it will be the issue with other as well.

(in the example prefix is set to `tw-` so all classes and utilities are used with `tw-`, when you remove `tw-` and delete prefix in config all works as expected).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Utilities do not work with prefix" (#11656)

Issues.Title: Arbitrary values for all background properties default to 'background-color'
Issues.Body: **What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** "tailwindcss": "^3.2.0", **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** "next": "13.1.6", **What version of Node.js are you using?** 18.14.2 **What browser are you using?** Chrome **What operating system are you using?** MacOS **Reproduction URL** https://play.tailwindcss.com/eSQwSZBLBQ A Tailwind Play link or public GitHub repo that includes a minimal reproduction of the bug. **Please do not link to your actual project**, what we need instead is a _minimal_ reproduction in a fresh project without any unnecessary code. This means it doesn't matter if your real project is private/confidential, since we want a link to a separate, isolated reproduction anyways. A reproduction is **required** when filing an issue ‚Äî any issue opened without a reproduction will be closed and you'll be asked to create a new issue that includes a reproduction. We're a small team and we can't keep up with the volume of issues we receive if we need to reproduce each issue from scratch ourselves. **Describe your issue** I want to use a custom linear gradient on a page as an arbitrary value stored as a CSS variable. [In the docs, it says that the way to do this](https://tailwindcss.com/docs/background-image#arbitrary-values) is `bg-[var(--gradient)]` but this compiles down to the following image: It looks like tailwind can't determine the difference between an arbitrary background color or image. Is that right? Thanks in advance!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Arbitrary values for all background properties default to 'background-color'" (#11652)

Issues.Title: CDN Not Available for 3.3.3
Issues.Body:
The CDN is not available for 3.3.3

https://cdn.tailwindcss.com/3.3.3

Is there typically an expected delay between a release and when the CDN is made available?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "CDN Not Available for 3.3.3" (#11650)

Issues.Title: The `static` keyword
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

 "tailwindcss": "^3.3.3"

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

"next": "13.4.10"

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v18.16.1

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

Windows

**Describe your issue**

Hi,

When I use `static` keyword in `javascript`, then `className: static` is generated ‚ú®

- w/o `static` keyword

![image](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/assets/15698245/286d8c58-b541-4f2f-b7cd-ed616e97640b)

- w `static` keyword

![image](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/assets/15698245/5934618f-ac20-4c7f-bc12-2dea7d62d0c4)

- and make sure i don't use `static className`

![image](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/assets/15698245/525c0ce1-8fe3-48e3-89c4-7f3283adbc3b)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "The `static` keyword" (#11640)

Issues.Title: Tailwind gradients classes doesn't work when build Gridsome project
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**
- "tailwindcss": "latest" (currently 3.3.3)

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**
- Gridsome

**What version of Node.js are you using?**
- v14.21.3

**What browser are you using?**
- Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**
- macOS

**Reproduction URL**

https://tw.sekretar.bg/ - Super simple project only with gradient background classes.
https://github.com/Guliat/tw-issue - Public repository of the project

**Describe your issue**
If you inspect the div element from the project I provide you will see there are gradient classes, but the gradient is missing.
This is only when you build the project (gridsome build), When I work locally (gridsome develop) everything is ok, the classes works properly.
I research a lot, but without any success. I am not sure if is issue with PostCSS or with the Tailwind plugin for Gridsome.
I use Tailwind for all my projects (mostly VueJS) and I never have this issue, so I think is something  specific with Gridsome build process.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Tailwind gradients classes doesn't work when build Gridsome project" (#11638)

Issues.Title: error while referencing tailwind color from css
Issues.Body:
![image](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/assets/138553763/4b0d95b8-8c2e-4550-aab8-6553919d28eb)

So I am getting this error when accessing to tw colors with dots. 
However it doesn't occur when i try to access in following ways:
* theme(colors[slate].50)
* theme("colors.slate.50")

(my config file is default one that comes with create-next-app)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "error while referencing tailwind color from css" (#11629)

Issues.Title: Default XS break point has higher order than other break points !
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

    "tailwindcss": "^3.2.7",

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

 "vite": "^4.1.0",

default XS break point has higher order than others , for example when i use class like this : 'xs:w-1/2 sm:w-1/3 md:w-1/4' w-1/2 come for all break points then we must use it with important label like this  'xs:w-1/2 sm:!w-1/3 md:!w-1/4 '
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Default XS break point has higher order than other break points !" (#11619)

Issues.Title: Drop shadow not working
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

For example: v3.3.3

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Remix v1.18.1

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v18

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS

**Reproduction URL**

https://play.tailwindcss.com/j18fc6gFQJ

**Describe your issue**

The `drop-shadow` utility class is not working correctly. 

It's producing this class:
```css
.drop-shadow-2xl {
  --tw-drop-shadow: drop-shadow(0 25px 25px rgb(0 0 0 / 0.15));
  filter: var(--tw-blur) var(--tw-brightness) var(--tw-contrast) var(--tw-grayscale) var(--tw-hue-rotate) var(--tw-invert) var(--tw-saturate) var(--tw-sepia) var(--tw-drop-shadow);
}
```

When it should be the one below (according to the docs):
```css
filter: drop-shadow(0 25px 25px rgb(0 0 0 / 0.15));
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Drop shadow not working" (#11612)

Issues.Title: CDN throw error "No utility classes were detected in your source files."
Issues.Body: **What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** CDN - https://cdn.tailwindcss.com **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** Nuxt 2.17.0 **What version of Node.js are you using?** V16.16 **What browser are you using?** Chrome / Arc **What operating system are you using?** macOS **Reproduction URL** https://stackblitz.com/edit/nuxt-starter-drwk2h?file=nuxt.config.js **Describe your issue** Using the Tailwind through the CDN throws this warning "warn - No utility classes were detected in your source files. If this is unexpected, double-check the `content` option in your Tailwind CSS configuration." The config was set as it's documented. Warning sometimes disappears to repro, refresh the page a couple of times until it shows up Tailwind config and CDN
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "CDN throw error "No utility classes were detected in your source files."" (#11608)
